questions.qText: Q1(I). In a YDSE setup (\(\lambda = 500\,\text{nm}, d = 2\,\text{mm}, D = 4\,\text{m}\)), with light incident at \(\theta = 30^{\circ}\), find the location of the central maxima on the screen.
Q1(II). For the same setup, find the order of the bright fringe at point O.
Q1(III). Find the fringe width of the pattern formed near O for the same data.
Q1(IV). Find the location of the 10th order bright fringe on either side of the central maxima.
Q2(I). In YDSE (\(\lambda = 600\,\text{nm}, d = 2.5\,\text{mm}, D = 2\,\text{m}\)) where \(\sin\theta = \frac{25\lambda}{6d}\), find the location of the central maxima.
Q2(II). Find the intensity at point O in the same setup, given intensity from one slit is \(I_0\).
Q2(III). Find the fringe width on the screen near O.
Q2(IV). Find the location of the 10th order bright fringe on either side of the central maxima.
Q2(V). Find the y-coordinate of the nearest bright spots on either side of O.
Q3. In the shown Young’s double-slit experiment, the central maxima is formed at:
Q4(a). In YDSE, a monochromatic source of wavelength \(\lambda\) is placed at distance \(\frac{d}{2}\) from central axis (see figure). Find the position of the central maxima.
Q4(b). Find the order of interference formed at point O in the same setup.

Q4(c). The source is placed on the center dotted line. Find the minimum thickness of a film (\(\mu = 1.5\)) to be placed in front of one slit so that intensity at O becomes \(\tfrac{3}{4}\)th of maximum.
Q5. In the adjacent diagram, CP represents a wavefront and A0, BP are rays. Find the condition on \(\theta\) for constructive interference at P between BP and reflected OP.
Q6. In a modified YDSE (\(\lambda = 6000\,\text{Å}\)), zero-order and 10th-order maxima occur at 12.34 mm and 14.73 mm. If \(\lambda\) is changed to 5000 Å, find new positions of these maxima.
Q7. Match the following for the given figure (\(S_1,S_2,S_3,S_4\)), where line PO is bisector and screen intensities are given.
Q8. Light of wavelength \(\lambda\) in air enters a medium of refractive index \(\mu\). Two points separated by distance x have phase difference equal to:
Q9. A double-slit setup immersed in liquid of refractive index 1.33 has slit separation 0.7 mm, screen distance 4 m, and light of \(\lambda = 6300\,\text{Å}\). Find the fringe width.
Q10. In YDSE inside water (\(\mu = \tfrac{4}{3}\), \(f = 6\times10^{14}\,\text{Hz}\)), slit separation 0.2 mm, screen 1 m. Find fringe width in water and in air.
Q11. When the YDSE apparatus is moved from air into water, the fringe pattern:
Q12. In YDSE, if one slit transmits half the intensity of the other, the fringe system will:
Q13. In YDSE, a plate of refractive index \(\mu\) and thickness \(t\) is placed before one slit. Find minimum \(t\) to make central intensity zero.
Q14. Light of \(\lambda = 5890\,\text{Å}\) used in YDSE. One slit covered with sheet (\(\mu=1.3\), thickness 1.4×10⁻⁵ m). Number of fringes shifted is:
Q15. For light of 5000 Å on two slits 1 mm apart at 1 m, a glass plate (\(\mu=1.5, t=1.5×10^{-6}\,\text{m}\)) is placed before one slit. Find lateral shift of central maximum.
Q16. Light travels through glass plate (thickness \(t\), index \(\mu\)). If c is speed in vacuum, time to travel is:
Q17. In ideal YDSE, glass plate (\(\mu=1.5\)) of thickness t introduced in one path without changing central intensity. Find t.
Q18. In YDSE, fringes shift by x when plate (\(\mu=1.5\)) inserted. If another plate of same t but index \(\mu_2\) causes shift (3/2)x, find \(\mu_2\).
Q19. In the shown YDSE, mica sheet (thickness \(t\), index \(\mu\)) in front of \(S_1\). If shifted to \(S_2\), number of fringes crossing centre O is:
Q20. Interference fringes produced by double slit; glass plate \(\mu=1.5\) causes 30 fringe shift for \(\lambda=6\times10^{-5}\,\text{cm}\). Find \(t/6\).
Q21. In YDSE with medium \(\mu\): transparent slab \(\mu=1.2\) before upper slit shifts central max down. If slab of 2t and 2µ placed before lower slit restores position, find \(\mu\).
Q22(a). Double slit in liquid \(\mu=1.33\), d=1 mm, D=1.33 m, \(\lambda=6300\,\text{Å}\). Find fringe width.
Q22(b). For Q22(a), one slit has glass plate (\(\mu=1.53\)). Find smallest thickness for adjacent minima on same axis.
Q23. YDSE shown; glass slab in front of \(S_2\). Match Column I with II.
Q24. Fringes (\(\lambda=4800\,\text{Å}\)), thin glass \(\mu_1=1.4\), \(\mu_2=1.7\) before slits. Central bright shifts to 5th bright. Find t.
Q25(a). In YDSE, d=1.2 mm, D=1 m, \(\beta=0.25\,\text{mm}\). When D reduced, fringe width becomes 2/3 of original. Find refractive index of medium.
